title: LD50 in Mice Exposed to Mutagen for 30 days

content.description: The graph below shows the <math alttext="L D 50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LD50</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for two different species of mice after being exposed to a mutagen for 30 days.
content.question: Based on the data in the graph, which of the following should be used to calculate the difference in <math alttext="L D 50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LD50</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for the two different species of mice?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 200 milligrams minus 100 milligrams over 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>200</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mn>100</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 490 milligrams over 50 minus 575 milligrams over 50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>490</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>575</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 600 milligrams times 50 over 30 days" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>600</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle><mo>×</mo><mn>50</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>y</mi><mi>s</mi></mstyle></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 6.A: Determine an approach or method aligned with the problem to be solved.
